Package alfdozen.es_2023_2sem_terca_teira_leipl_grupoa

Class App

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
alfdozen.es_2023_2sem_terca_teira_leipl_grupoa.App
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class App extends javafx.application.Application implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
The App class launches the stage, sets the main menu scene and manages the GUI components and events in the scene. The user can click on different buttons to go to the the corresponding scenes (importSchedule, importWebcal, createSchedule and convertFile). The exit button is used to close the application. If the user already imported a schedule file, the viewSchedule button is visible and can be clicked to go to the viewSchedule scene.
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
alfdozen

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
      This method is called after the init method has returned, and after the system is ready for the application to begin running. It receives the primary stage for the application and sets the main scene. If an error occurs while doing this, an error dialog is shown and the application shuts down.
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - the primary stage for this application, onto which the application scene can be set.

    • setSchedule

      public static void setSchedule(Schedule newSchedule)
      Sets a new value of schedule to the global instance of schedule.
      Parameters:
      newSchedule - the new schedule to update the global schedule

    • setStageResize

      public static void setStageResize(boolean bool)
      Defines if the the application's main stage can be resizable or not.
      Parameters:
      bool - option a boolean value that if true allow resizing or false to disable resizing)

    • setStageSize

      public static void setStageSize(double width, double height)
      This method sets the stage size according to the width and heigh received.
      Parameters:
      width - the width to set the stage to.
      height - the height to set the stage to.

    • setRoot

      public static void setRoot(String fxml) throws IOException
      This methods sets the root of the scene, effectively changing scenes according to the received fxml file.
      Parameters:
      fxml - the relative path to the fxml file to set the scene to.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs while changing the scene.

    • loadFXML

      private static javafx.scene.Parent loadFXML(String fxml) throws IOException
      This method loads a parent scene from the received fxml file.
      Parameters:
      fxml - the relative path to the fxml file to load.
      Returns:
      the parent scene loaded from the fxml file.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs while loading the fxml file.

    • importSchedule

      private void importSchedule()
      This method is called by the event of clicking on the importScheduleButton. It changes to the importSchedule scene. If an error occurs while doing this, an error dialog is shown and the application shuts down.

    • importWebcal

      private void importWebcal()
      This method is called by the event of clicking on the importWebcalButton. It changes to the importWebcal scene. If an error occurs while doing this, an error dialog is shown and the application shuts down.

    • createSchedule

      private void createSchedule()
      This method is called by the event of clicking on the createScheduleButton. It changes to the createSchedule scene. If an error occurs while doing this, an error dialog is shown and the application shuts down.

    • convertFile

      private void convertFile()
      This method is called by the event of clicking on the convertFileButton. It changes to the convertSchedule scene. If an error occurs while doing this, an error dialog is shown and the application shuts down.

    • viewSchedule

      private void viewSchedule()
      This method is called by the event of clicking on the viewScheduleButton. It changes to the viewSchedule scene. If an error occurs while doing this, an error dialog is shown and the application shuts down.

    • closeWindow

      private void closeWindow()
      This method is called by the event of clicking on the closeWindowButton. It closes the stage, effectively shutting down the application.

    • showLectureConflicts

      static void showLectureConflicts()
      Shows a new stage with a list of all the lecture conflicts in the schedule. The conflicts are displayed using the "Overlayed.fxml" file. If there is an IO exception while loading the FXML file, no action is taken.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL arg0, ResourceBundle arg1)
      This method is called after its root element has been completely processed and initializes the GUI components and stage in the controller needed for the main scene. If the schedule object is not null and has lectures, the viewScheduleButton is shown. Otherwise, it is hidden.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      arg0 - the location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
      arg1 - the resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main method of this application. It launches the application in the main menu.
      Parameters:
      args - the command line arguments.
